speaker: Doctor
text: "Can you tell me more about when you first started experiencing shortness of breath? Was it sudden or did it come on gradually?"

speaker: Patient
text: "I actually noticed it started about a month ago, and at first, I thought it was just from being out of shape from the school year, but it's been getting worse and I'm finding myself needing to catch my breath even when I'm just sitting or standing still."

speaker: Doctor
text: "Okay, so it's been worsening over the past month, and you initially thought it was due to being out of shape. Can you tell me if you've noticed any other symptoms such as chest pain, dizziness, or weight loss?"

speaker: Patient
text: "No, I haven't experienced any chest pain, dizziness, or weight loss. To be honest, I've been a bit concerned about the increase in my abdominal size, but I hadn't thought much of it until you brought it up. I've noticed my clothes feel a bit tighter than usual."

speaker: Doctor
text: "Can you tell me more about the increase in your abdominal size? Was it sudden or did it develop gradually, and have you noticed any other symptoms such as nausea, bloating, or pain in the abdominal area?"

speaker: Patient
text: "I think it's been gradually getting bigger, to be honest, I've been noticing it for a few weeks now, but I didn't think much of it. It's just that my clothes aren't fitting as well as they used to, and I've been feeling a bit uncomfortable in them, but I haven't really paid much attention to it until you mentioned it."

speaker: Doctor
text: "Okay, so the abdominal size has been gradually increasing over the past few weeks, and you're feeling uncomfortable in your clothes. Have you noticed any changes in your menstrual cycle or periods, or any unusual bleeding?" Also, I'd like to perform a physical examination to assess your overall condition. Can you please remove your top and stand up for me, so I can inspect your abdomen and check for any masses or other abnormalities?"

speaker: Patient
text: "I'm not sure if it's related to my menstrual cycle, but I haven't really noticed any significant changes, just that my periods seem to be a bit lighter than usual lately. I'm not really sure what to expect, I've always had regular periods, but maybe it's just a coincidence?"

speaker: Doctor

"I'd say I'm not as active as I used to be, I have to take breaks to catch my breath even when I'm just doing simple tasks, but I'm trying to manage it. I'm also finding it harder to sleep at night because I have to get up frequently to catch my breath." "That's concerning. Can you tell me more about your sleep patterns? Do you wake up frequently during the night or have you noticed any changes in your sleep quality?" "I've been waking up a lot more during the night, feeling like I'm not getting enough oxygen. text: "I know it's not ideal, but I've been trying to get enough rest and take it easy when I need to. speaker: Doctor
